unit_learning_outcomes.description: Investigate the significance of Coptic for the study of relevant ancient cultures
Recognize and memorize extended Coptic vocabulary
Identify and recall Coptic grammatical structures at more advanced level
Integrate knowledge of grammar and vocabulary in reading and/or writing Coptic texts
Assess grammar, explore grammatical reference tools, and recognise and recall linguistic technical terms

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will need to prepare exercises each week and revise the grammar and vocabulary done previously.

assessments.description: A fortnightly short-answer test of 10 points of grammar taken from the previous lessons
Two assignments consolidate the grammar and vocabulary learned to the time when each assignment is set.
An exam in the Exam period will bring together everything studied in the course and demonstrate an understanding of Coptic vocabulary and grammar.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.description: This unit builds upon AHIS1160 by offering students the opportunity to consolidate their knowledge of the Coptic language through a study of a range of Sahidic texts. Coptic is the final stage of the Egyptian script and language, a knowledge of which is necessary for advanced study of late antique and Christian Egypt. It is also of great benefit to those studying earlier phases of the Egyptian language. This unit focuses on the Sahidic ('Upper Egyptian') dialect, the first Coptic dialect into which biblical texts were translated in the third century. Sahidic became a pan-Egyptian written dialect in the fourth and following centuries, and boasts a rich literature, both original and translated.
data.title: Coptic Egyptian B
